title: Johnny Depp rocks out at hotel launch as he is ordered to submit drug and alcohol medical records
text:
He has been ordered to hand over his drug and alcohol medical records by the judge presiding over his $50 million defamation case against ex-wife Amber Heard.

But Johnny Depp looked in high spirits as he rocked out to the star-studded crowd at at the opening of the Seminole Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Hollywood, Florida, on Thursday night.

The actor, 56, laughed and smiled while performing in the Council Oak Steakhouse after his former spouse's lawyers were given permission to look into whether he may have abused other past partners last week.

Carefree: Johnny Depp looked in high spirits as he rocked out to the star-studded crowd at at the opening of the Seminole Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Hollywood, Florida, on Thursday

Performance: Depp played an electric guitar in his trademark rock star ensemble - adding various chains to a black and white scarf worn over a black T-shirt

Depp played an electric guitar in his trademark rock star ensemble - adding various chains to a black and white scarf worn over a black T-shirt.

He added a grey striped cap to finish off the look and looked unfazed as laughing revellers, including the likes of Khloe Kardashian, Sofia Richie and Bella Thorne, danced around him.

The Seminole Hard Rock Hotel and Casino has been built in the shape of a guitar.

It's located on 100 acres of the Hollywood Reservation of the Seminole Tribe of Florida.

Rock star: The actor, 56, performed in the Council Oak Steakhouse after his former spouse's lawyers were given permission to look into whether he abused other past partners

Another string to their bow: The Seminole Hard Rock Hotel and Casino has been built in the shape of a guitar

It's the latest step in the Seminole Hard Rock empire, which includes naming rights on the Miami-area stadium where the 2020 Super Bowl will be played.

Amber Heard's lawyers want Depp to present his medical records, and other material related to his alcohol and drug use, in the next stage of the ongoing defamation case.

Depp is suing Heard, 33, for $50million claiming she defamed him by writing an op-ed in 2016 about domestic violence.

Ex wife: Amber Heard's lawyers want Depp to present his medical records (pictured in Paris on September 28)

She did not include his name but he says she publicly implicated him by writing it.

Now, she is trying to prove that he did beat her during their short marriage - a claim that has long been denied by him throughout their divorce and subsequent spats.

The couple were married from 2015 until 2018.

On Friday, Heard's attorneys also asked the judge to allow them to prove that Depp might have been violent towards other, past partners.

They say his alleged drug and alcohol abuse fuelled the physical abuse and so is relevant to the case.

According to Deadline, Johnny has a certain amount of time to produce the documents.

They report: 'By November 15, 2019, Plaintiff must produce all non-privileged, responsive documents requested by Defendant’s document requests,' Fairfax County Chief Judge Bruce White ordered on October 18 of the motion filed by Heard’s team.

New location: The Guitar Hotel is located on 100 acres of the Hollywood Reservation of the Seminole Tribe of Florida

Wow! No expense has been spared with the new complex, with fireworks being blasted off the lit-up roof at night

Hanging out with the boys: Actor Jeremy Piven (centre) shared this snap of himself, Depp and Miguel (left)

Heard’s Virginia lawyer J. Benjamin Rottenborn said last month: 'Mr. Depp cannot seek to litigate the truth of Ms. Heard's allegations about his violent and abusive behaviour while intoxicated, insist on proceeding without a protective order, and then blithely refuse to produce evidence that confirms the truth of those allegations on grounds of relevance and privacy.'

However, Johnny's lawyers have accused Heard's team of trying to get access to his medical files to go on a 'fishing expedition' to embarrass and 'harass' him.

Despite Depp's claims that it was irrelevant, the judge decided to allow the application made on behalf of Heard.

Heard's team did not name of the other partners they claim he may have been abusive towards.

Night out: Depp is suing ex-wife Amber Heard, 33, for $50million claiming she defamed him by writing an op-ed in 2016 about domestic violence

Defamation: Johnny's lawyers have accused Heard's team of trying to get access to his medical files to go on a 'fishing expedition' to embarrass and 'harass' him

'He says he is not a perpetrator of domestic violence. So we have requested documents relating to Mr. Depp's commission of domestic violence against other romantic partners,' her lawyer, Ben Rottenborn, said.

The judge then asked why he had stated in his lawsuit that he had never been domestically violent towards anyone.

His attorney said: 'Mr. Depp understood that this case, since the public op-ed, is going to be in the public press. And so it's important for him to say that.'

She also said it was 'troubling' that Depp's actors submitted claims in their lawsuit against Heard for the purpose of having them reported on by the media.

Abuse? Heard has submitted photos in previous proceedings which she claims show injuries Depp gave her; he has long denied being violent towards her and is suing her for defamation

Heard's lawyers previously tried to keep the case private.

She said she did not want aspects of her personal life or of the lives of people close to them to be made public.

Depp's attorneys have repeatedly claimed he has 'nothing to hide'.

His lawyer told DailyMail.com that Heard's latest claims were part of a 'notorious abuse hoax.'

'Having been sued for defamation her notorious abuse hoax, Amber Heard’s #TimesUp lawyer doesn’t waste any time trying to prove the unprovable, or dispute the mountain of evidence showing her fraud.

'Instead, they do what the guilty always do, compounding the original crime with new false abuse allegations and other smearing innuendo. There is a public trial February 3, and that is when truth replaces PR.'
description: The actor, 56, looked in high spirits as he rocked out to the star-studded crowd at at the opening of  the Seminole Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Hollywood, Florida, on Thursday night.
